Spotify Announces Strategic Acquisition of Podcast Technology Leader, Megaphone http://www.conferencecalltranscripts.org/summary/?id=91231&pr=true $SPOT

links.title: Conference Call Transcripts
links.description: Get notified next time SPOT.US makes a similar move! NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Spotify Technology S.A. (NYSE:SPOT), the world's most popular audio streaming subscription service, today announced that the company has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Megaphone, one of the world's most innovative podcast advertising and publishing platforms. Together, Spotify and Megaphone will help advertisers and podcast publishers realize the full potential of podcasts.

messages.body: Graham Holdings Company to Sell Megaphone to Spotify http://www.conferencecalltranscripts.org/summary/?id=91229&pr=true $SPOT

links.title: Conference Call Transcripts
links.description: Get notified next time SPOT.US makes a similar move! ARLINGTON, Va.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Graham Holdings Company (NYSE: GHC) announced today that it has entered into an agreement with Spotify Technology S.A. (NYSE: SPOT) to sell Megaphone for $235 million. Megaphone is a podcast technology company that provides hosting and ad-insertion capabilities for publishers and targeted ad sales for brand partners.

links.title: Spotify to buy ad tech firm Megaphone to monetize podcasts | PageOne
links.description: (Reuters) - Sweden-based Spotify Technology SA SPOT.N has agreed to buy podcast advertising and publishing platform Megaphone, it said on Tuesday, the latest in a series of a deals to boost its podcast platform. The deal is worth $235 million, a Spotify spokesman said.

messages.body:
$SPOT $GHC Spotify's latest podcast deal is $235M for Megaphone platform 

https://newsfilter.io/a/c7632971acbf3a4afec63f11fdc12071

links.title: Spotify's latest podcast deal is $235M for Megaphone platform
links.description: Spotify has a definitive agreement to acquire podcast advertising/publishing platform Megaphone from Graham Holdings - the latest in a series of acquisitions in the hot sector.The deal is for $235M, Graham Holdings says. The company is touting the acquisition as the ability to make its streaming ad insertion available to third-party podcast publishers for the first time.
